```{r, include=FALSE}

# set up -----------------------------
library(RPostgreSQL)
source("W:\\RDA Team\\R\\credentials_source.R")
# remotes::install_github("catalystcalifornia/rdaCharts") 
library(rdaCharts)
library(stringr)
library(htmltools)
library(htmlwidgets)
library(gtExtras)
library(gt)

#connect to postgres
source("W:\\RDA Team\\R\\credentials_source.R")

con <- connect_to_db("eci_fresno_ripa")

# pull analysis table for visualizing
df<-dbGetQuery(con, "SELECT * FROM report_traffic_type_race")%>%
  mutate(race_label=case_when(
    race == "latinx" ~ "Latinx",
    race == "nh_aian" ~ "AIAN NH",
    race == "nh_black" ~ "Black",
    race == "nh_multiracial" ~ "Multiracial",
    race == "nh_nhpi" ~ "NHPI NH",
    race == "nh_sswana" ~ "SSWANA NH",
    race == "nh_white" ~ "White",
    race == "aian_aoic" ~ "AIAN", 
    race == "nhpi_aoic" ~ "NHPI",
    race == "sswana_aoic" ~ "SWANA/SA",
    race == "nh_asian_wo_sa" ~"Asian",
    race == 'nh_asian' ~ "Asian", 
    .default = race)) %>%
  filter(race!="nh_sswana")


# filter dataframes for population denominator which is the one I want to visualize
df_pop<-df%>%
  filter(denom=="population_per_1k")%>%
  filter(!grepl("nh_aian|nh_nhpi", race))%>%
  filter(race!="nh_asian")%>% # I want to use the Asian calc that omits South Asian from the denominator
  arrange( -rate)

```

```{r, include=FALSE}
# Set up embed info------------------

# create caption 
sourcenote<-"Catalyst California calculations based on City of Fresno's Police Stop Data (2022), catalystcalifornia.org, 2024. "

methodnote <- "Analysis for all officer-initiated stops made by officers in 2022."

racenote <- "Race/ethnicity: AIAN=American Indian or Alaska Native, NHPI=Native Hawaiian or Pacific Islander, SWANA/SA=Southwest Asian (Middle Eastern) or North African, or South Asian."

caption_text <- paste("<br>", racenote, sourcenote, methodnote)

# create tooltip text

tooltip_text <- "Out of 1,000 <b>{point.race_label}</b> people who live in Fresno City, Fresno PD stopped <b>{point.rate:.1f}</b> people they perceived as <b>{point.race_label}</b> in a <b>{point.traffic_violation_type} traffic stop<b>,  or a total of <b>{point.count:.1f}</b> people."

# visualize  --------------------------

# Deciding to move forward with the pop denominator
chart_pop<-rdaStackedBar(
  df_pop,
  "race_label",
  "rate",
  "traffic_violation_type",
  theme="theme_fbhc",
  title = "Fresno PD Disproportionately Burdens Black People in Fresno with Traffic Stops Across all Stop Types",
  subtitle = "Rate of officer-initiated traffic stops by traffic stop type and perceived race per 1k of total population",
  tooltip_text = tooltip_text,
  caption = caption_text,
  export_data_label = list(pointFormat='{point.rate:.1f}') 
)

```
